headline: The Securities That Banks Are Backing Away From: Credit Weekly
summary: (Bloomberg) -- US banks, among the few companies that still sell preferred shares, are following JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s lead and retreating from the securities, even as investors are eager to buy them. headline: Jim Cramer Considers Morgan Stanley a “Tremendous” Investment Bank
summary: Morgan Stanley (NYSE:MS) is one of the 22 stocks Jim Cramer recently talked about. Highlighting its recent dividend boost and buyback program, Cramer said: “Morgan Stanley said they’re putting through an 8.1% dividend hike, which translates to a 2.8% yield with the stock at these levels. headline: Morgan Stanley: A 7% Yield On The Preferred Shares
summary: Morgan Stanley's Series E preferred shares offer a 7.1% yield, strong coverage, and resilience. Check out my analysis of MS stock and its preferred shares.

headline: 5 Relatively Secure And Cheap Dividend Stocks, Yields Up To 9% (July 2025)
summary: It is best to invest regularly and consistently in good, solid dividend-paying stocks with reasonable or attractive valuations. Check out five such stocks here.
